complaint.description: Today I signed another 2 years with Vodacom and what an experience. You sign a new contract but you cannot cancel the recurring data you have to phone another number. You also cannot cancel the numbers you do not use you have to phone another number that is different from the recurring data number. Then I get told that I could have got a much better package once I get through to the person on the other side. The question to Vodacom should you not look at your customers and sell them the best package according to their usage,  rather than just want to get them to sign for another 2 years. Look at what the customer is doing you have the data. Also older people do not want to speak to Tobi as Tobi did not help at all. I just spend 1 hour on the phone to try and get through to a person that could help me. So now I am not sure if I got the right subscription as I got 2 conflicting sales pitches. Not good
complaint.suggestion: Improve customer service by providing better assistance and personalized package recommendations based on customer usage. Ensure that customers can easily reach a person for assistance instead of relying on chatbots.
